title: Cloverfield movie logo straight-sided tech sans
content:
Hello typomaniacs, any idea what the font used for “Cloverfield” might be? I thought either Reykjavik or Metroflex, but I don’t think it’s either one of those. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071203194453im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cloverfield_5223.jpg)

 [‹ Rocky Balboa font??](http://web.archive.org/web/20071203194453/http:/typophile.com/node/39674 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Vive Latino 2005 banner - Samdan {Jan S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071203194453/http:/typophile.com/node/39659 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Chris Keegan

comments.content: Yeah, I was wondering about that one myself. I think it might be a PrimeType font, something like PTL Notes or something. Lemmecheck.
No no no, I just can’t seem to find it. I think I recognize that C though, I just don’t know where it’s from. :^/
It does look familiar. I’ll keep looking as well. Thanks.

I think it’s Primetypes PTL Notes.  
 [http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=34](http://web.archive.org/web/20071203194453/http:/www.primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=34 "http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=34")

edit: sorry, should have read the entry above.
I forgot about Acme. Nice catch, thanks!
